chineseMeaning: v. 取消；撤回；下相反的命令取消;
examples: I have now to countermand that order,in consequence of the receipting of the letter this morning.

chineseMeaning: adj. 隐蔽的；偷偷摸摸的；隐密的; n. 掩蔽物；树丛；覆羽;
examples: Some people say this was a covert scheme.
I was only doing my job as a covert agent.
He stole a covert glance at her across the table.

chineseMeaning: n. 母牛；雌象；雌鲸；雌犀牛；女人; v. 恐吓;
examples: The cow has produced a calf.
Do you know how to milk a cow?

chineseMeaning: n. 大批的离去;  Exodus：（《圣经·旧约》中的）出埃及记.;
examples: A massive exodus of doctors is forcing the government to recruit from abroad.
Even in August, when a mass.holiday exodus leaves Milan virtually deserted, the small square outside the church bustles with activity.

chineseMeaning: adj. (价格等)过高的；过分的；不合法的;
examples: The price of food here is exorbitant.
That hotel charges exorbitant prices.
You should be sensible and not make exorbitant demands.

chineseMeaning: adj. 易膨胀的；广阔的；滔滔不绝的；健谈的;
examples: Birdsong's answer was expansive.
After he'd had a few drinks, Charles became very expansive.
Today Sarah became jovial and expansive.
Expansive persons found him a little dry.

chineseMeaning: n. 远征；探险队；迅速;
examples: They equipped themselves for the expedition.
They planned to organize a scientific expedition.
He is the commander of the expedition.
The expedition suffered all the rigors of a Canadian winter.
The mail is conveyed with expedition.
We strived to work with great expedition.

chineseMeaning: vi. 终止；期满；失效；呼气；断气;
examples: Our holidays expire next week.
My passport is due to expire in two months.
When does your driving licence expire?
My credit card will expire in June.
We expire used air from our lungs.

chineseMeaning: adj. 笨拙的；粗鲁的；不善交际的;
examples: He now seems gauche and uninteresting.
He's rather gauche; he hasn't found his feet socially yet.
I find him terribly gauche.

chineseMeaning: n. 测量仪器；测量标准；（铁道的）轨距；（钢丝等的）直径；（枪管的）口径; v. 估计；判断；测量;
examples: The fuel gauges dropped swiftly.
What gauge of wire should we use for this job?
This is a narrow-gauge railway.
The gauge of the barrel was about 2 inches wide.

chineseMeaning: adj. 友好的；(气候)温暖的;
examples: Her genial smile made every guest feel at home.
The Nankun Mountain with a genial climate is an ideal holiday resort.
The genial warmth of the sun around the door appeared somewhat human.

chineseMeaning: n. 木材；木料; v. 伐木; vi. 缓慢地移动; vt. 拖累;
examples: I followed the road down past the piles of lumber.
Iron mined in order to topple trees for lumber.
They slapped together a cabin out of old lumber.
Among the sawmill customers are the chair factory and other users of cut lumber.

chineseMeaning: v. 突然倾斜；蹒跚地走；(突然感到恐怖或激动时心或胃)猛地一跳(或动); n. 举步蹒跚；突然倾斜;
examples: Suddenly the horse lurched to one side and the child fell off.
The man lurched drunkenly out of the pub.

chineseMeaning: adj. 有光泽的；光辉的；光亮的；皎洁的;
examples: Are the cultured pearls as lustrous and beautiful as the natural ones?
Cadmium is a lustrous, silver-white, ductile, very malleable metal.
The moon was above, lustrous and serene.

chineseMeaning: n. 莫名的不安；身体不适;
examples: The country is laden with economic and political malaise.
You can see signs of malaise in our office.
He coughed with sputum and feeling of malaise.
Calcium deficiency is the main cause of this malaise .
Usually it begins with fever, poor appetite, malaise and sore throat.

chineseMeaning: adj. 怀恶意的；恶毒的;
examples: He was bespattered by malicious gossip .
This malicious and unprovoked attack astounded him.
You ought to kick back at such malicious slander.
The girl's reputation was defiled by malicious gossips.

chineseMeaning: vi. 装病（以逃避工作）;
examples: We were  told by her doctor that she was malingering.

chineseMeaning: v. 磨损；拖着脚走; n. 拖着脚走；磨损;
n. 坏血病; adj. 下流的；卑鄙的;
examples: The crew remained free from scurvy.
Vitamin C, found in citrus fruits, prevents scurvy.

chineseMeaning: adj. 与世隔绝的；隐退的；隐蔽的；僻静的;  动词seclude的过去式和过去分词.;
examples: The idiom is used to describe a secluded and peaceful utopia.
He remains secluded in his room.
He decided to live a secluded life after retirement.
Sergeant Pond is a secluded, tree-ringed, spring-fed oasis.
This is the quietest and most secluded area of the city.

chineseMeaning: adj. 安静的；镇静的; vt. 使安静；使镇静;
examples: A sedate color scheme calls for an obvious place for the eye to rest.

chineseMeaning: v. (狗)摇摆(尾巴)；(狗尾巴)摇摆；摇(头或手表示不赞成)；逃学；饶舌；离别; n. 摇摆；诙谐幽默的人；逃学;
examples: Dogs wag their tails when they are pleased.
The dog's tail wagged.
They often persuaded me to wag school.
The news set tongues wagging.
His silvery tongue began to wag.

chineseMeaning: n. 漫游癖；旅游热;
examples: There was a faraway hint of wanderlust in his expression.
This phenomenon,sometimes called wanderlust,
They nurtured my coming with wanderlust.
He did not understand the wanderlust that drove you to leave your homeland.

chineseMeaning: v. 要；想要；通缉; n. 缺乏；贫穷；需求品;
examples: I want large ones, not small ones.
He wants me to go with him.
What they talked about is what we want to know.
He is wanted by the police.

chineseMeaning: vt. 使翘起；弄歪；歪曲; vi. 变歪；扭曲; n. 弯曲；歪曲；乖僻；经纱；绞船索;
examples: His judgement was warped by self-interest.
Histories are often warped by biases.
